# UIGraphicsImageRendererFormat.Range.standard

**Case**

The image renderer context doesn’t support extended colors.

## Declaration

```swift
case standard
```

## Discussion

If you draw wide-color content into an image renderer context that uses the standard color range, you may lose color information. The system matches the colors to the standard range of their corresponding color space.

## Constants

- **UIGraphicsImageRendererFormat.Range.automatic**: The system automatically chooses the image renderer context’s pixel format according to the color range of its content.
- **UIGraphicsImageRendererFormat.Range.extended**: The image renderer context supports wide color.
- **UIGraphicsImageRendererFormat.Range.unspecified**: The image renderer context doesn’t specify a color range.
